response_metadata.response_text:
{
"overview": "The Judiciary's proposal for the Kona Women’s Court pilot project has been updated from a two-year to a \"three-year pilot project\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). The purpose remains to make the First Circuit's Women's Court permanent and establish a pilot in the Third Circuit's Kona division (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). The Judiciary requests modifications to appropriations to ensure the pilot is \"fully funded through fiscal year 2027-2028\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt).",
"appropriations": "The Committee on Ways and Means has \"amended this measure by changing the appropriations to unspecified amounts to facilitate further discussion on the measure\" (HB727_SD2). This replaces the specific amounts listed in the previous version of the bill. The Department of Health also submitted a request for a budget of \"$221,788 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) to support the Kona division pilot project,\" which includes funding for a Clinical Psychologist and a Social Worker (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt).",
"assumptions_and_methodology": "The Judiciary's proposal has been updated from a two-year pilot project to a \"three-year pilot project\" to reflect the current version of the bill (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). The financial projections are now based on a three-year timeline with a total requested budget of just over \"$1.50 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) million\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). The assumption is that this investment will result in cost savings, as it is anticipated the program will help more than six women avoid incarceration (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt).",
"agency_impact": "The Department of Health has submitted testimony requesting a budget of \"$221,788 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) to support the Kona division pilot project\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). This funding is for two specific positions: a \"1.0 FTE Clinical Psychologist [$145,000] (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) to provide forensic psychological consultation\" and a \"1.0 FTE Social Worker/Human Services Professional IV [$76,788] (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) to conduct screenings and provide forensic coordination\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). Your Committee notes that the Department of Health requests $221,788 (HB727_SD2) to support the Kona division pilot program.",
"economic_impact": "The Judiciary testimony provides a new cost-benefit analysis, stating that the \"cost of incarceration of just one person for three years is $277,035.10 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). Based on this figure, the testimony projects that \"if KWC helps keep just six (6) women out of prison, the program will have already paid for itself\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). This suggests a significant potential for cost savings to the state by reducing incarceration rates (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt).",
"policy_impact": "",
"revenue_sources": "",
"six_year_fiscal_implications": "The Judiciary has updated its proposal to a three-year pilot project with a total cost of \"$1,576,900.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). The proposed budget is now broken down over three fiscal years. The cost for fiscal year 2025-2026 is \"$514,900.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). The cost for fiscal year 2026-2027 is now projected to be \"$547,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). A new budget for fiscal year 2027-2028 has been added, with a cost of \"$515,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). Recurring annual costs include \"$175,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" for a Women's Mental Health Professional, \"$100,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" for Women's Behavioral Health Beds, and \"$85,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" for a Kona Drug Court Probation Supervisor (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). Additional annual costs are \"$80,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" for a Peer Specialist, \"$30,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" for a Cultural Practitioner, \"$25,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" for Moral Reconation Therapy, and \"$10,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" for Increased Drug Testing/Lab confirmation (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). Training costs are specified as \"$5,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" in Year 1 and \"$42,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" in Year 2 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). Year 3 includes \"$10,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" for Program Evaluation (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). Despite this detailed request, the Committee on Ways and Means has amended the measure to have unspecified appropriations (HB727_SD2).",
"operating_revenue_impact": "",
"capital_expenditure_impact": "",
"fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The Judiciary's updated testimony clarifies the long-term goal for the program after the now proposed \"3-year project period\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). If the pilot is successful, the intent is to \"expand the Women’s Court program to Hilo and make the program permanent\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). This extends the timeline for considering permanence and expansion from two years to three (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt).",
"updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "The pilot program's duration has been extended from two years to a \"three-year pilot project\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt), with the total requested budget from the Judiciary increasing to \"$1,576,900.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). A new budget for a third year has been introduced at \"$515,000 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). Most significantly, the Committee on Ways and Means has \"amended this measure by changing the appropriations to unspecified amounts\" (HB727_SD2), removing the specific funding amounts that were in the prior version of the bill. A new agency impact has been identified, with the Department of Health requesting \"$221,788 (HB727_SD2)\" to support the pilot with a Clinical Psychologist and a Social Worker. Finally, the Judiciary provided new data for economic impact, citing the three-year cost of incarceration for one person as \"$277,035.10 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" and stating the program could pay for itself by keeping six women out of prison (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)."
}

"overview": "The Judiciary's proposal for the Kona Women’s Court pilot project has been updated from a two-year to a \"three-year pilot project\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). The purpose remains to make the First Circuit's Women's Court permanent and establish a pilot in the Third Circuit's Kona division (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). The Judiciary requests modifications to appropriations to ensure the pilot is \"fully funded through fiscal year 2027-2028\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt).",
"appropriations": "The Committee on Ways and Means has \"amended this measure by changing the appropriations to unspecified amounts to facilitate further discussion on the measure\" (HB727_SD2). This replaces the specific amounts listed in the previous version of the bill. The Department of Health also submitted a request for a budget of \"$221,788 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) to support the Kona division pilot project,\" which includes funding for a Clinical Psychologist and a Social Worker (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt).",
"assumptions_and_methodology": "The Judiciary's proposal has been updated from a two-year pilot project to a \"three-year pilot project\" to reflect the current version of the bill (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). The financial projections are now based on a three-year timeline with a total requested budget of just over \"$1.50 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) million\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). The assumption is that this investment will result in cost savings, as it is anticipated the program will help more than six women avoid incarceration (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt).",
"agency_impact": "The Department of Health has submitted testimony requesting a budget of \"$221,788 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) to support the Kona division pilot project\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). This funding is for two specific positions: a \"1.0 FTE Clinical Psychologist [$145,000] (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) to provide forensic psychological consultation\" and a \"1.0 FTE Social Worker/Human Services Professional IV [$76,788] (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) to conduct screenings and provide forensic coordination\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). Your Committee notes that the Department of Health requests $221,788 (HB727_SD2) to support the Kona division pilot program.",
"economic_impact": "The Judiciary testimony provides a new cost-benefit analysis, stating that the \"cost of incarceration of just one person for three years is $277,035.10 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). Based on this figure, the testimony projects that \"if KWC helps keep just six (6) women out of prison, the program will have already paid for itself\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). This suggests a significant potential for cost savings to the state by reducing incarceration rates (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt).",
"policy_impact": "",
"revenue_sources": "",
"six_year_fiscal_implications": "The Judiciary has updated its proposal to a three-year pilot project with a total cost of \"$1,576,900.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). The proposed budget is now broken down over three fiscal years. The cost for fiscal year 2025-2026 is \"$514,900.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). The cost for fiscal year 2026-2027 is now projected to be \"$547,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). A new budget for fiscal year 2027-2028 has been added, with a cost of \"$515,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). Recurring annual costs include \"$175,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" for a Women's Mental Health Professional, \"$100,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" for Women's Behavioral Health Beds, and \"$85,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" for a Kona Drug Court Probation Supervisor (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). Additional annual costs are \"$80,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" for a Peer Specialist, \"$30,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" for a Cultural Practitioner, \"$25,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" for Moral Reconation Therapy, and \"$10,000.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" for Increased Drug Testing/Lab confirmation (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). Despite this detailed request, the Committee on Ways and Means has amended the measure to have unspecified appropriations (HB727_SD2).",

"capital_expenditure_impact": "",
"fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The Judiciary's updated testimony clarifies the long-term goal for the program after the now proposed \"3-year project period\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). If the pilot is successful, the intent is to \"expand the Women’s Court program to Hilo and make the program permanent\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). This extends the timeline for considering permanence and expansion from two years to three (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt).",
"updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "The pilot program's duration has been extended from two years to a \"three-year pilot project\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt), with the total requested budget from the Judiciary increasing to \"$1,576,900.00 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). A new budget for a third year has been introduced at \"$515,000 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). Most significantly, the Committee on Ways and Means has \"amended this measure by changing the appropriations to unspecified amounts\" (HB727_SD2), removing the specific funding amounts that were in the prior version of the bill. A new agency impact has been identified, with the Department of Health requesting \"$221,788 (HB727_SD2)\" to support the pilot with a Clinical Psychologist and a Social Worker. Finally, the Judiciary provided new data for economic impact, citing the three-year cost of incarceration for one person as \"$277,035.10 (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)\" and stating the program could pay for itself by keeping six women out of prison (HB727_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt)."
}

chunk_details.chunk_text: STATE COUNCIL ON MENTAL HEALTH Testimony to the Senate Committee on Ways and Means In Support of HB727 HD1 SD1 March 31, 2025 10:02 a.m., Room 211 and Video Chair Dela Cruz, Vice Chair Moriwaki, and Members of the Committee: Hawaiʻi law, HRS §334-10, established the State Council on Mental

Hawaiʻi law, HRS §334-10, established the State Council on Mental Health as a 21-member body to advise on the allocation of resources, statewide needs, and programs affecting more than one county as well as to advocate for adults with serious mental illness, children with serious emotional disturbances, individuals with mental

mental illness, children with serious emotional disturbances, individuals with mental illness or emotional problems, including those with co-occurring substance abuse disorders. Members are residents from diverse backgrounds representing mental health service providers and recipients, students and youth, parents, and family members. Members include representatives of state agencies on mental health,

members. Members include representatives of state agencies on mental health, criminal justice, housing, Medicaid/MedQUEST, social services, vocational rehabilitation, and education. Members include representatives from the Hawaiʻi Advisory Commission on Drug Abuse and Controlled Substances and county service area boards on mental health and substance abuse. Most of the State Council

mental health and substance abuse. Most of the State Council on Mental Health members support this measure. The Women’s Court is one of the specialty courts that can be life- changing for people with mental illness or substance use disorders who become involved in the criminal justice system. The Women’s

who become involved in the criminal justice system. The Women’s Court will primarily address those who suffer from high trauma. Thank you for the opportunity to testify. Should you have any questions, please contact us at DOH.SCMHChairperson@doh.hawaii.gov. . VISION: A Hawaiʻi where people of all ages with mental health challenges

Hawaiʻi where people of all ages with mental health challenges can enjoy recovery in the community of their choice. MISSON: To advocate for a Hawaiʻi where all persons affected by mental illness can access necessary treatment and support to live full lives in the community of their choice. JOSH B.

appropriate moneys for the Women's Court pilot program. Circuit. Alliance on Prisons, and one individual. incarcerated women in the State. Given that this HD1, SD1 contemplates a three-year pilot, the only modification to the current bill that is being requested is additional appropriations to ensure that the pilot project is fully funded for the duration of the project period. The proposed budget for KWC is just over $1.5 million in total for the three-year pilot project. This investment in KWC will ultimately result in House Bill No. 727, H.D. 1, S.D. 1, Relating to the Women’s Court Senate Committee on Ways and Means Monday, March 31, 2025 Page 3 cost savings. three-year pilot project. This investment in KWC will ultimately result in House Bill No. 727, H.D. 1, S.D. 1, Relating to the Women’s Court Senate Committee on Ways and Means Monday, March 31, 2025 Page 3 cost savings. The cost of incarceration of just one person for three years is $277,035.1 This means that if KWC helps keep just six (6) women out of prison, the program will have already paid for itself, and it is anticipated that this program will help many more women than that.
